content: and slip_stitch along this line 3 chain 2 slip_stitch 1 then slip_stitch all the way back to the elbow on the back of the wing where you can only see a kind of dashed line folding the wing makes this easier 4 slip_stitch in the elbow then mark a 2nd line to the 3rd chain 3 turn and slip_stitch along this line 5 chain 2 slip_stitch 1 then slip_stitch all the way back to the elbow on the back of the wing where you can only see a kind of dashed line folding the wing makes this easier 6 keep single_crochet along the top edge of the wing until the end ~10 ch3 turn 7 2sl st then 10 slip_stitch again until the elbow when you reach the gap where you created the vertical lines single_crochet in one of the single_crochet of the row below to fill it ch3 slip_stitch 2 slip_stitch in the same prev single_crochet sl st until the beginning of the wing do the other wing in the same way making sure to flip it first so you have one left wing and one right wing sew to the back spikes small spike chain 2 slip_stitch in 2nd chain medium spike ch3 slip_stitch in 2nd chain single_crochet in next chain large spike ch4 slip_stitch in 2nd chain single_crochet in next chain half_double_crochet in next chain wide large spike ch4 slip_stitch in 2nd chain single_crochet in next chain double_crochet in next chain keep adding spikes until you have enough for the body of your dragon i like making smaller ones on the head and tail and larger ones on the back sew this to the body use the wires in the body and arms to shape your dragon so it can hold on to your laptop screen
